cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles SW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north-northwest today, turn north on Tuesday, then north-northeast toward the west coast of Florida mid-week and continue inland across Georgia and the Carolinas late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast near the Tampa Bay region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to the Anclote River FL (Tampa Bay area); no watches along the Georgia coast at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Grand Cayman and parts of western Cuba; Tropical Storm Warning for lower Florida Keys; none for Georgia coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern U.S. coastline from the Florida peninsula northward to the Georgia and South Carolina coasts lies within the day-4/5 cone of uncertainty
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible beginning late Friday with a small chance (14%) of 50-kt (58 mph) sustained winds; hurricane-force winds are very unlikely (3-6%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–3 ft possible along the Georgia coast due to prolonged onshore flow as Ian passes inland to the west
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain 3–6 inches, locally 8 inches, possible Friday–Saturday with flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; rough surf and dangerous rip currents beginning late week
